page.title: 18Recreation and Entertainment
page.content: Although people cry that there is not a lot to do the area is not poorly provided for. There are playing fields at Iwade, Kemsley and Quinton with a cricket field at Bobbing. There is a well appointed club at Kemsley with facilities for snooker, darts and many other pub games as well as being a popular dance and banqueting hall. A B.M.X cycle track has been built at Kemsley although it is occassionally used as a rubbish dumping ground. The Borough Council organise play schemes during the summer holiday period for each area of the population. The Woolpack Inn at Iwade has a florishing social club as does the Halfway pub at Bobbing. With the village halls at Iwade and Bobbing being very popular for dances and receptions the area is not without amenities.
